verb.description: Thrust or spread (things, especially limbs or fingers) out and apart.
examples: her hands were splayed across his broad shoulders
he stood with his legs and arms splayed out

noun.description: A tapered widening of a road at an intersection to increase visibility.
A surface making an oblique angle with another, such as the splayed side of a window or embrasure.
A splayed window aperture or other opening.

origin: Middle English (in the sense unfold to view, display): shortening of the verb display.
